intro: Calanthe yaoshanensis, commonly known as the Yaoshan calanthe, is a rare orchid species native to China. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its elegant, lance-shaped leaves and striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist forest environments, where it thrives in the undergrowth. Its flowers, which bloom in spring, are usually pink or white with a distinctive, intricate pattern. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Calanthe yaoshanensis is considered a delicate and endangered species.
